title: Unknown command line argument on configure
body:
I'm trying to create a package to install the [IEGenLib](https://github.com/CompOpt4Apps/IEGenLib).
However, during configure it cannot understand the line arguments following.

The package file is very simple:

```
from spack import *

class Iegenlib(Package):
    """Description"""

    homepage = "http://www.example.com"
    url      = "http://www.example.com/iegenlib-1.0.tar.gz"

    #version('1.0', '0123456789abcdef0123456789abcdef')
    version('master', branch='master', git='https://github.com/CompOpt4Apps/IEGenLib.git')

    depends_on("autoconf")
    depends_on("cmake")

    def install(self, spec, prefix):
        configure("--prefix %s" % prefix)
        make()
        make("install")
```
I get the following error:

 ```
==> ./configure --prefix /usr/workspace/wsa/bluenet/thiago/spack/opt/spack/chaos_5_x86_64_ib/gcc-5.3.0/iegenlib-master-pfjbuc2sjocs4trbys4onq7nx7sswqhd
Unknown command line argument '--prefix /usr/workspace/wsa/bluenet/thiago/spack/opt/spack/chaos_5_x86_64_ib/gcc-5.3.0/iegenlib-master-pfjbuc2sjocs4trbys4onq7nx7sswqhd'

Usage ./configure [options]

Supported options:
  --prefix DIR       : Installation prefix
  --gen-parser       : Generate the parser code using Flex/Bison
  --build-python     : Build the IEGen Python bindings
  -h | --help        : Print this help message
```
